item.title: 20 世纪 90 年代为何人人都如此乐观
item.description:
回顾一段充满希望的市场和现实生活。【原文：

Looking back at a period of hope in the markets and real life.

】

item.title: 华尔街最大债券看跌者认为美国 10 年期债券收益率将突破 5
item.description: 这位华尔街最大的债券看空者今年开局不错，因为美国国债收益率正朝着他的逆向预测靠拢。【原文：The biggest bond bear on Wall Street is having a good start to the year as US Treasury yields edge toward his deeply contrarian forecast.】

item.title: 自由党逼迫执政九年的特鲁多辞职
item.description: 贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）在领导加拿大九年多之后，因支持率下降和党内反叛而辞职。【原文：Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is resigning after more than nine years leading Canada, bowing to sagging approval numbers and a rebellion within his political party.】

item.title: 迈克尔-巴尔将卸任美联储负责监管的副主席一职
item.description: 美联储负责监管的副主席迈克尔-巴尔（Michael Barr）计划辞去这一职务。【原文：Michael Barr, the Federal Reserve’s vice chair for supervision, plans to step down from that role.】

item.title: 谷歌将为运行其软件的电视机配备双子座人工智能系统
item.description: Alphabet 公司的消费者团队将为运行其 Google TV 操作系统的电视机进行人工智能升级，在其 Google Assistant 语音控制系统中加入 Gemini。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s consumer team will give TV sets running its Google TV operating system an AI upgrade by adding Gemini to its Google Assistant voice-control system.】

item.title: 高通公司的新芯片将为 600 美元的个人电脑带来人工智能
item.description: 高通公司（Qualcomm Inc.【原文：Qualcomm Inc. introduced new chips designed to power personal computers capable of running the latest artificial intelligence software yet cost as little as $600.】

item.title: 特朗普表示不会削减关税后黄金下跌
item.description: 在当选总统唐纳德-特朗普表示不会缩减其关税政策计划后，黄金保持跌势。【原文：Gold held losses after President-elect Donald Trump said his tariff policy plan won’t be pared back.】

item.title: 欧元为何再次逼近美元平价
item.description: 自 1999 年欧元问世以来，该货币与美元等值交易的次数屈指可数。上一次是在 2022 年，当时俄罗斯全面入侵乌克兰，引发了欧洲的能源危机，并引发了对经济衰退的担忧，使货币对的比价跌至 1:1。现在，市场观察人士认为这种情况有可能再次发生。【原文：Since the euro came into existence in 1999, the currency has traded at equal value to the US dollar only a handful of times. The last instance was in 2022, after Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine sparked an energy crisis in Europe and provoked fears of a recession, plunging the currency pair to a 1:1 ratio. Now, market watchers see a chance it will happen again.】

item.title: 加拿大特鲁多在数月压力后辞去党魁职务
item.description: 贾斯汀-特鲁多摄影师：Dave Chan/Getty Images【原文：Justin Trudeau Photographer: Dave Chan/Getty Images】

item.title: 设计受挫后，EDF 将简化小型核反应堆
item.description: 法国电力公司正在简化其小型模块化核反应堆的设计，目标是取代燃煤发电厂。【原文：Electricite de France SA is simplifying the design of its small modular nuclear reactors, targeted to replace coal-fired power plants.】

item.title: 降临公司与杜克梅奥餐厅所有者绍尔品牌达成协议
item.description: 据知情人士透露，收购公司 Advent International 已同意从 Falfurrias Capital Partners 手中收购杜克蛋黄酱品牌所有者 Sauer Brands Inc.【原文：Buyout firm Advent International has agreed to acquire Sauer Brands Inc., the owner of the Duke’s mayonnaise brand, from Falfurrias Capital Partners, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 伯克希尔旗下贷款公司因 "负担不起 "贷款遭 CFPB 起诉
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway Inc.【原文：A lender owned by Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway Inc. knowingly issued “unaffordable” home mortgages by ignoring the insufficient income or assets of some borrowers, a top financial regulator alleged in a lawsuit Monday.】

item.title: 美国银行称，25 年平均油价为 65 美元，欧佩克+将继续承压
item.description: 据美国银行（Bank of America Corp）称，由于非欧佩克国家的新增石油产量超过了全球原油消费量的增长，国际基准布伦特原油今年的平均价格将达到每桶 65 美元。【原文：International benchmark Brent crude will average $65 a barrel this year as new oil production from non-OPEC countries outstrips the growth in global crude consumption, according to Bank of America Corp.】

item.title: 美联储库克称官员可对降息更加谨慎
item.description: 美联储理事丽莎-库克（Lisa Cook）表示，政策制定者可以更加谨慎地进行更多的降息，理由是劳动力市场强劲，近期通胀数据也有波动。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook said policymakers can proceed more cautiously with additional rate cuts, citing a sturdy labor market and recent bumpiness in inflation data.】

item.title: 战争使通胀压力持续，以色列维持利率不变
item.description: 以色列中央银行维持利率不变，因为它预计该国与伊朗支持的民兵组织的多线战争将带来更大的通胀压力。【原文：Israel’s central bank left interest rates unchanged as it anticipates more inflationary pressure stemming from the country’s multi-front war against Iran-backed militias.】

item.title: 亚马逊的 Ring 首推每月 5 美元的烟雾监控服务
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）的 Ring 家庭安防部门周一宣布升级烟雾和一氧化碳监控功能，并为部分摄像头提供更高质量的视频。【原文：Amazon.com Inc.’s Ring home security unit on Monday announced upgrades for smoke and carbon monoxide monitoring as well as higher-quality video for some of its cameras.】

item.title: 英特尔称新笔记本电脑芯片将延长电脑电池寿命
item.description: 英特尔公司（Intel Corp. ）一直在抵御笔记本电脑处理器领域日益激烈的竞争，该公司表示，一系列新的芯片将有助于实现笔记本电脑最长的电池续航时间。【原文：Intel Corp., which has been fending off mounting competition in notebook processors, says a new range of chips will help enable the longest battery life available in laptops.】

item.title: 欧盟将关注 X 如何对待马斯克与德国极右翼领导人的活动
item.description: 欧盟表示，将密切关注埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）即将在其 X 社交媒体网络上对德国极右翼领导人爱丽丝-魏德尔（Alice Weidel）进行的采访是否违反了欧盟的内容审核规则。【原文：The European Union said it will closely monitor whether Elon Musk’s upcoming interview with German far-right leader Alice Weidel on his X social media network runs afoul of its content moderation rules.】

item.title: 可可上涨，因担心科特迪瓦出口放缓将导致供应紧张
item.description: 可可在纽约攀升至一周多来的最高点，因为人们越来越担心，头号生产国象牙海岸的供应量减少将进一步挤压本已紧张的市场。【原文：Cocoa climbed to the highest in more than a week in New York, on mounting concerns that smaller supplies from top producer Ivory Coast will further squeeze an already tight market.】

item.title: 墨西哥启动 2025 年拉美主权债务销售计划
item.description: 墨西哥拉开了 2025 年拉丁美洲主权债券发行的序幕，申请出售硬通货债务，这将是克劳迪娅-谢因鲍姆总统执政以来的首次发行。【原文：Mexico kicked off Latin America sovereign bond offerings for 2025, filing to sell hard-currency debt in what would be the first issuance of President Claudia Sheinbaum’s administration.】

item.title: 热带水果供应商 Alico 因疾病和风暴停止生产
item.description: Alico 公司是美国最大的柑橘种植商之一，也是 Tropicana 的供应商，在经历了数十年因疾病和飓风造成的产量下降后，该公司将关闭其柑橘部门。【原文：Alico Inc., one of the biggest US orange growers and a supplier to Tropicana, will wind down its citrus division after a decades-long decline in production caused by disease and hurricanes.】

item.title: 微策略公司增发优先股后买入比特币
item.description: 微策略公司（MicroStrategy Inc）在宣布将使用永久优先股、普通股和债务收购更多加密货币后，又买入了 1.01 亿美元的比特币。【原文：MicroStrategy Inc. bought $101 million of Bitcoin after announcing that it would use perpetual preferred stock as well as common shares and debt to acquire more of the cryptocurrency.】

item.title: 智利央行警告利率走势存在 "重大风险
item.description: 智利央行在上一次关键利率会议的会议记录中表示，未来的货币政策决策应考虑包括短期通胀挑战在内的重大风险。【原文：Chile’s central bank said its future monetary policy decisions should consider significant risks including short-term inflation challenges, according to the minutes to its last key rate meeting.】

item.title: 德国通胀增幅超预期，支持欧洲央行的谨慎态度
item.description: 德国上个月的通胀速度超过了预期，为欧洲中央银行继续逐步降低利率的计划提供了支持。【原文：German inflation accelerated more than predicted last month, backing the European Central Bank’s plans to keep cutting interest rates only gradually.】

item.title: 财富经理们涌向南美富人的海滩天堂
item.description:
埃斯特角城正在成为乌拉圭吸引外国资金的磁铁。因此，卫生、房地产和机场项目正在进行中。【原文：

Punta del Este is becoming a magnet for foreign money in Uruguay. Health, real estate and airport projects are underway as a result.

】

item.title: 拜登的阻挠引发诉讼后，美国钢铁业的下一步将如何发展？
item.description:
美国公司及其日本收购方正在对这一决定提出异议，但他们的选择有限。【原文：

The American company and its Japanese suitor are contesting the decision, but their options are limited.

】

item.title: Citadel 将非竞争期延长至 21 个月以留住人才
item.description: 肯-格里芬（Ken Griffin）的 Citadel 公司将一些投资组合经理的竞业禁止协议延长至 21 个月，凸显出多策略对冲基金之间的招聘大战仍在持续。【原文：Ken Griffin’s Citadel prolonged its non-compete agreements for some portfolio managers to 21 months, underscoring the unrelenting hiring war among multistrategy hedge funds.】

item.title: 拜登阻止交易后，新日铁、美国钢铁公司提起诉讼
item.description: 新日本钢铁公司（Nippon Steel Corp.）和美国钢铁公司（United States Steel Corp.）联合提起诉讼，为维持上周被美国总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）阻止的两家公司合并计划做出最后努力。【原文：Nippon Steel Corp. and United States Steel Corp. jointly filed lawsuits in a last-ditch effort to preserve the planned merger of the companies, which was blocked last week by President Joe Biden.】

item.title: CES 的价值远不止会场上的展品
item.description: 本周在拉斯维加斯举行的消费电子展（CES）上，虽然华丽的宴会厅展览可能会吸引公众的眼球，但真正的活动将在楼上的酒店套房里与交易商们展开。但首先...【原文：While the flashy ballroom exhibitions may draw the public attention this week at CES in Las Vegas, the real action will be upstairs in the hotel suites with the dealmakers. But first...】
